text: hello everyone in this video I'm going
to talk about how to express ratios in
English it's quite easy let's take a
look I have two examples here the first
example is about my party I had a party
these are my guests 100 guests 75 of my
guests were men 25 of my guests were
women so what's the ratio well here it
is so how would i express the ratio well
the simple way is just to say 3 2 1 3 2
1 the colon here we always say - 3 2 1
but let's make a complete and full
sentence so I would say the ratio of men
to women at my party was 3 2 1 the ratio
of men to women at my party was 3 2 1
alright let's move on to the next
example talking about buttons I got 3
red buttons 2 blue buttons 6 black
buttons ok what's the ratio of buttons
ok we're going to use three numbers and
simply you would say 3 2 2 to 6 that's
the ratio of buttons 3 2 2 to 6 okay
easy let's take a look at a few more
examples alright let's look at the first
ratio example the ratio of boys to girls
in China is a hundred and ten to 100 the
ratio of boys to girls in China is 110 -
the next example there are two apples
and three oranges the ratio is two to
three there are two apples and three
oranges the ratio is two to three and
the last example the ratio of children
teenagers and adults is 7 to 3 to 1 the
ratio of children teenagers and adults
is 7 to 3 to 1 ok so I hope you have a
better understanding of how to express
ratios in English before we end this
video I just want to talk about
expressing scores okay in a game so here
is a soccer game between Korea and Japan
and Korea wins they have two goals and
Japan only has one goal so what's the
score you would just say the same 2 2 1
all right that's easy so that's how you
